div.l: Oure hors is lorne Aleyne for cockes banys
Step out on the fete come thennce atanys
Allas oure wardeyne hath our palfrey lorn
This aleyn alle forgate bath mele and corn
Alle was out of mynde his housbandry
Whate whilke wey is he gon he gan cry
The wiff cam rennynge inward at a renne
She seide allas yoᵘur hors goth to fenne
With wilde marys as fast as he may go
Vnthanke come on his hede that bonde hȳm so
And he that bettir shuld haue knyt the reyne
Allas quod Iohn allas for cristes peyne
Ley done thy swerde and I wille myne alswa
I is fulle swyfte god wote as is a Raa
Be cockes hert he shalt not a scape it bath
Why ne had thou put the capil in to the lath
Ille haile be god aleyne thou is a fonne
This sely clerkes haue wel fast y ronne
Taward the fenne both aleyn and eke Iohn
And whan the myller sawe they were gon
He halfe a boysshel of her mele hath take
And bade his wiff goo knede it in a cake
And seide I trowe the clerkes were aferde
Yet can a Miller make a clerkes berde
For al her art yet let hem go her wey
Lo where they gone so lett the children play
They gete hem not so lightly be my croune
This sely clerkes rennen vp and doune
Wᵗith kepe kepe / stonde / stonde Iossa ware derere
Ga swifte thou there and I shalle kepe hȳm here
But shortly tille it was verely nyght
